content.title: Dialysis Catheters
content.definition: Tunneled cuffed catheters for bridge or last resort. Highest infection and mortality. Right IJ preferred site.
content.statement: Dialysis Catheters is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Dialysis-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Dialysis Catheters helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Dialysis Catheters include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Dialysis Catheters.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
